definition: to scale (a height)/to ascend/to mount/to publish or record/to enter (e.g. in a register)/to press down with the foot/to step or tread on/to put on (shoes or trousers) (dialect)/to be gathered and taken to the threshing ground (old)
"house on a cliff" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 53), occurring in 店, 序, 底 etc
to say/to tell/to announce/to report/to denounce/to file a lawsuit/to sue

sentences.english: Why don''t you put an advertisement in the paper to sell that old car?
sentences.chinese: 为什么不在报上登广告卖旧车呢？

sentences.english: We advertised our services to make more bussiness.
sentences.chinese: 我们登广告宣传自己的服务项目来招揽生意。

sentences.english: The publishing firm was advertising for a typist.
sentences.chinese: 这家出版公司正在登广告招聘一名打字员。

sentences.english: The school advertised for teachers in the newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 学校在报纸上登广告征聘教师。

sentences.english: You can also use us to find new ways to place ads on your site.
sentences.chinese: 您也可以使用我们寻找新的方法来登广告对你的网站。

sentences.english: Medical ethics do not permit doctors to advertise.
sentences.chinese: 医德不允许医生登广告。

sentences.english: Mr. Lin advertises in order to sell the goods.
sentences.chinese: 林先生为了出售货物而登广告。

sentences.english: She advertised her house for sale.
Mr. Wang advertised for a maid.
sentences.chinese: 王先生登广告征求女佣。

sentences.english: Many women advertise for mother's helpers to room in with families and help take care of children.
sentences.chinese: 很多妇女登广告雇请住雇主家帮助带小孩的保姆。

sentences.english: We advertised for pupils last autumn, and got more than 60.
sentences.chinese: 去年秋天我们曾登广告招生，并且招了60多名。

definition: announcement (written, on billboard, letter, newspaper or website)/to post information/a notice
to log out (computer)/to publish/to be published/to appear (in a newspaper etc)
to carry a story/to publish (in a newspaper or magazine)
